alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 02 at 3:55PM EST until February 04 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total ice accumulations of up to one quarter inch possible in parts of the Wyoming Valley, and around a half inch possible in higher terrain areas. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Wyoming, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike and Southern Wayne counties. In New York, Sullivan county. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Scattered rain and a few snow showers are possible overnight, changing to all rain by Thursday morning. A cold front will move in from the north, changing rain to a mix of freezing rain and sleet, and eventually some snow Thursday evening into Friday. Considerable uncertainty remains in how far south the colder air will move in, and sleet may develop at the expense of freezing rain. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. &&
